required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Axitinib (AG-013736) With Or Without Dose Titration (Increase) In Patients With Kidney Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-blind Phase 2 Study Of Axitinib (Ag-013736) With Or Without Dose Titration In Patients With Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: Axitinib dose titration (giving a higher dose of the drug above its standard starting dose) among certain patients may improve the response to treatment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR) - Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to disease progression, death, or withdrawal; performed at baseline and repeated every 8 weeks for 24 weeks, then every 12 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: ORR was defined as the proportion of participants with objective response based assessment of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST v1.0). CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease. No new lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease on study under baseline of the sum of longest diameters of all target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to disease progression, death, or withdrawal; performed at baseline and repeated every 8 weeks for 24 weeks, then every 12 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: The time from first dose administration to first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause. PFS in each arm was assessed using the Kaplan-Meier method and estimates of the PFS curves from the Kaplan-Meier method were presented.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to disease progression, death, or withdrawal; performed at baseline and repeated every 8 weeks for 24 weeks, then every 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: DR was defined as the time from the first documentation of objective tumor response (complete response - CR or Partial response - PR) to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurred first. The median values were estimated based on Kaplan-Meier method. 95% confidence interval was based on the Brookmeyer and Crowley method.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to disease progression, death, or withdrawal; performed at baseline and repeated every 8 weeks for 24 weeks, then every 12 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from date of the first dose of the study medication to date of death due to any cause. For participants who did not die, their survival times were to be censored at the last date they were known to be alive.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Axitinib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 2 Day 15 (C2D15): pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, and 6 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15. Results were normalized to axitinib 7 mg dose for active titration arm and axitinib 5 mg dose for placebo titration arm. Results were normalized to axitinib 7 mg dose for active titration arm and axitinib 5 mg dose for placebo titration arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) for Axitinib,
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) for Axitinib
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measurable concentration (AUClast). AUClast for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15. Results were normalized to axitinib 7 mg dose for active titration arm and axitinib 5 mg dose for placebo titration arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 24 Hours[AUC(0-24)] for Axitinib
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero 24 hours[AUC(0-24). AUC(0-24) for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15. Results were normalized to axitinib 7 mg dose for active titration arm and axitinib 5 mg dose for placebo titration arm.
Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half. Plasma decay half life for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.

Clearance (CL) of a drug is a measure of the rate at which a drug is metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes. Clearance obtained after oral dose (apparent oral clearance) is influenced by the fraction of the dose absorbed (F). Clearance is defined as the volume of blood from which drug can be completely removed per unit of time. CL/F for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution During the Elimination Phase (Vz/F) for Axitinib
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of distribution is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Vz/F is influenced by the fraction absorbed. Vz/F for steady-state axitinb was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At screening (D-14 to D-1); lead-in period: Cycle 1 - Day 1 and Day 15; Cycle 2 - Day 1 and Day 15; Cycle 3 & subsequent cycles Day 1; end of study and follow-up 28 days after last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Value at respective visit minus value at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Diastolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At screening (D-14 to D-1); lead-in period: Cycle 1 - Day 1 and Day 15; Cycle 2 - Day 1 and Day 15; Cycle 3 & subsequent cycles Day 1; end of study and follow-up 28 days after last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Value at respective visit minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Circulating Endothelial Cells (CECs) in Blood: Cluster of Differentiation (CD)146+/CD105+ at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline - Beginning of the lead-in period (Cycle 1 Day 1)
secondary_outcome.description: CECs are noninvasive marker of vascular damage, remodeling, and dysfunction. Samples were collected and following proteins were analyzed: CD146+/CD105+ CECs, CD146+/CD105+ mean fluorescence intensity (MFI) platelet derived growth factor receptor (PDGFR)-beta, CD146+/CD105+ MFI phospho-PDGFR (pPDGFR)-beta, CD146+/CD105+ phospho-Vascular endothelial growth factor receptor (pVEGFR), CD146+/CD105+ MFI VEGFR. The ratio of plasma levels of the biomarkers at the selected time point vs baseline is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the Ratio of CECs in Blood: CD146+/CD105+ at Each Time Point to Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of the lead-in period (Cycle 1 Day 15), Cycle 2 Day 15 and End of therapy (EOT)
secondary_outcome.description: CECs are noninvasive marker of vascular damage, remodeling, and dysfunction. Samples were collected and following proteins were analyzed: CD146+/CD105+ CECs, CD146+/CD105+ MFI platelet derived growth factor receptor (PDGFR)-beta, CD146+/CD105+ MFI phospho-PDGFR (pPDGFR)-beta, CD146+/CD105+ phospho-VEGFR (pVEGFR), CD146+/CD105+ MFI VEGFR. The ratio of plasma levels of the biomarkers at the selected time point vs baseline is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Circulating Endothelial Cells (CECs) in Blood: CD31+/CD146+
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline - Beginning of the lead-in period (Cycle 1 Day 1)
secondary_outcome.description: CECs are noninvasive marker of vascular damage, remodeling, and dysfunction. Samples were collected and following proteins were analyzed: CD31+/CD146+ CECs, CD31+/CD146+ MFI PDGFR-beta, CD31+/CD146+ MFI pPDGFR-beta, CD31+/CD146+ pVEGFR, CD31+/CD146+ MFI VEGFR. The ratio of plasma levels of the biomarkers at the selected time point vs baseline is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Ratio of CECs in Blood: CD31+/CD146+ at Each Time Point to Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of the lead-in period (Cycle 1 Day 15), Cycle 2 Day 15 and End of therapy (EOT)
secondary_outcome.description: CECs are noninvasive marker of vascular damage, remodeling, and dysfunction. Samples were collected and following proteins were analyzed: CD31+/CD146+ CECs, CD31+/CD146+ MFI PDGFR-beta, CD31+/CD146+ MFI pPDGFR-beta, CD31+/CD146+ pVEGFR, CD31+/CD146+ MFI VEGFR. The ratio of plasma levels of the biomarkers at the selected time point vs baseline is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: ORR in Subgroups That Were Defined by Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor A (VEGFA) or Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor 3 (VEGFR3) Polymorphisms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline - Beginning of the lead-in period (Cycle 1 Day 1)
secondary_outcome.description: ORR, defined as proportion of participants with CR or PR according to RECIST, in subgroups that were defined by VEGFA or VEGFR3 polymorphisms.

secondary_outcome.measure: PFS in Subgroups That Were Defined by Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor A (VEGFA) or Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor 3 (VEGFR3) Polymorphisms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline - Beginning of the lead-in period (Cycle 1 Day 1)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS, defined as the time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, in subgroups that were defined by VEGFA or VEGFR3 polymorphisms. Estimates of the PFS curves from the Kaplan-Meier method were presented.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- metastatic renal cell carcinoma (kidney cancer) with clear cell component
- no prior systemic therapy (including no prior adjuvant or neoadjuvant)
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status 0-1
- Blood Pressure < or = 140/90mmHg
Exclusion Criteria:
- brain/CNS metastasis
- using more than 2 blood pressure medications

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: axitinib or AG-013736 dose titration (increase) renal cell carcinoma

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at 49 centers in Czech Republic, Germany, Japan, Russian Federation, Spain, and the United States (US).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were enrolled in a 4-week lead-in period, during which they received axitinib 5 milligram (mg) twice a day (BID). After the lead-in period, participants meeting randomization criteria were then randomized to one of the two treatment arms. Participants, not meeting criteria, continued study without dose titration (non-randomized arm).

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Placebo Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Non-randomized Arm
group.description: Participants not eligible for randomization were assigned to receive axitinib 5 mg BID or a reduced dose per the dose modification guideline. Dose titration was not permitted in this treatment arm.

group.title: Discontinued Prior to Randomization
group.description: Participants who discontinued before they were randomized to any of the treatment or non-randomized arms.

participants_list.participants: Study Completion: 29 Feb 2016. Treatment discontinued due to objective progression/relapse & death

outcome.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR) - Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
outcome.description: ORR was defined as the proportion of participants with objective response based assessment of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST v1.0). CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease. No new lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease on study under baseline of the sum of longest diameters of all target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to disease progression, death, or withdrawal; performed at baseline and repeated every 8 weeks for 24 weeks, then every 12 weeks.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis (FA) population included all randomized participants who received study drug or different drug to which they were randomized. The Safety Analysis (SA) population included all non-randomized patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication with treatment assignments designated according to actual study treatment received.

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Non-randomized Arm
group.description: Participants not eligible for randomization were assigned to receive axitinib 5 mg BID or a reduced dose per the dose modification guideline. Dose titration was not permitted in this treatment arm.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: All enrolled participants (randomized and non-randomized)

measure.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR) - Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
measure.description: ORR was defined as the proportion of participants with objective response based assessment of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST v1.0). CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease. No new lesions. PR was defined as >=30% decrease on study under baseline of the sum of longest diameters of all target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions.
measure.population: The Full Analysis (FA) population included all randomized participants who received study drug or different drug to which they were randomized. The Safety Analysis (SA) population included all non-randomized patients who received at least 1 dose of study medication with treatment assignments designated according to actual study treatment received.

analysis.groups_desc: ORR for the 2 treatment arms was compared with the Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel test stratified by ECOG performance status. The relative risk ratio estimator was used to contrast the treatment effects on the endpoint. Both a point estimate and a 2-sided 95% CI were calculated using a normal approximation.
analysis.p_value_desc: A priori defined threshold for statistical significance was: alpha=0.10 (one-sided)

outcome.description: The time from first dose administration to first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause. PFS in each arm was assessed using the Kaplan-Meier method and estimates of the PFS curves from the Kaplan-Meier method were presented.

measure.description: The time from first dose administration to first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause. PFS in each arm was assessed using the Kaplan-Meier method and estimates of the PFS curves from the Kaplan-Meier method were presented.

outcome.description: DR was defined as the time from the first documentation of objective tumor response (complete response - CR or Partial response - PR) to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurred first. The median values were estimated based on Kaplan-Meier method. 95% confidence interval was based on the Brookmeyer and Crowley method.

outcome.population: Subset of Full Analysis (FA) and Safety Analysis (SA) patients who achieved confirmed complete or partial response. FA included all randomized patients and was based on randomized treatment assignment regardless of whether or not study drug was administered. SA included all non randomized patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

measure.description: Tmax for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) for Axitinib
outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measurable concentration (AUClast). AUClast for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15. Results were normalized to axitinib 7 mg dose for active titration arm and axitinib 5 mg dose for placebo titration arm.
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Placebo Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

measure.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) for Axitinib
measure.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measurable concentration (AUClast). AUClast for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15. Results were normalized to axitinib 7 mg dose for active titration arm and axitinib 5 mg dose for placebo titration arm.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 24 Hours[AUC(0-24)] for Axitinib
outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero 24 hours[AUC(0-24). AUC(0-24) for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15. Results were normalized to axitinib 7 mg dose for active titration arm and axitinib 5 mg dose for placebo titration arm.
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

measure.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 24 Hours[AUC(0-24)] for Axitinib
measure.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero 24 hours[AUC(0-24). AUC(0-24) for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15. Results were normalized to axitinib 7 mg dose for active titration arm and axitinib 5 mg dose for placebo titration arm.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

outcome.title: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2) for Axitinib
outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half. Plasma decay half life for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib(blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo[blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

measure.title: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2) for Axitinib
measure.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half. Plasma decay half life for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

outcome.title: Apparent Oral Clearance (CL/F) of Axitinib
outcome.description: Clearance (CL) of a drug is a measure of the rate at which a drug is metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes. Clearance obtained after oral dose (apparent oral clearance) is influenced by the fraction of the dose absorbed (F). Clearance is defined as the volume of blood from which drug can be completely removed per unit of time. CL/F for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib(blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Placebo Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

measure.title: Apparent Oral Clearance (CL/F) of Axitinib
measure.description: Clearance (CL) of a drug is a measure of the rate at which a drug is metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes. Clearance obtained after oral dose (apparent oral clearance) is influenced by the fraction of the dose absorbed (F). Clearance is defined as the volume of blood from which drug can be completely removed per unit of time. CL/F for steady-state axitinib was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

outcome.title: Apparent Volume of Distribution During the Elimination Phase (Vz/F) for Axitinib
outcome.description: Volume of distribution is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Vz/F is influenced by the fraction absorbed. Vz/F for steady-state axitinb was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib(blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Placebo Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo[blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

measure.title: Apparent Volume of Distribution During the Elimination Phase (Vz/F) for Axitinib
measure.description: Volume of distribution is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Vz/F is influenced by the fraction absorbed. Vz/F for steady-state axitinb was evaluated on Cycle 2 Day 15.
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) population included all participants who were treated and had at least 1 concentration on 1 PK assessment day. The PK parameter analysis data set included all participants treated who had at least 1 estimated PK parameter of primary interest.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Value at respective visit minus value at baseline
outcome.time_frame: At screening (D-14 to D-1); lead-in period: Cycle 1 - Day 1 and Day 15; Cycle 2 - Day 1 and Day 15; Cycle 3 & subsequent cycles Day 1; end of study and follow-up 28 days after last dose.
outcome.population: The SA population consists of all participatns who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib(blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Placebo Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Non-randomized Arm
group.description: Participants not eligible for randomization were assigned to receive axitinib 5 mg BID or a reduced dose per the dose modification guideline. Dose titration was not permitted in this treatment arm.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure
measure.description: Value at respective visit minus value at baseline
measure.population: The SA population consists of all participatns who received at least one dose of study medication.

measure.population: The SA population consists of all participatns who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Comparison of Circulating Endothelial Cells (CECs) in Blood: Cluster of Differentiation (CD)146+/CD105+ at Baseline
outcome.description: CECs are noninvasive marker of vascular damage, remodeling, and dysfunction. Samples were collected and following proteins were analyzed: CD146+/CD105+ CECs, CD146+/CD105+ mean fluorescence intensity (MFI) platelet derived growth factor receptor (PDGFR)-beta, CD146+/CD105+ MFI phospho-PDGFR (pPDGFR)-beta, CD146+/CD105+ phospho-Vascular endothelial growth factor receptor (pVEGFR), CD146+/CD105+ MFI VEGFR. The ratio of plasma levels of the biomarkers at the selected time point vs baseline is reported.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline - Beginning of the lead-in period (Cycle 1 Day 1)
outcome.population: The Biomarker Analysis Set included participants receiving at least one dose of treatment, with a Cycle 1 Day 1 biomarker result for at least one biomarker.

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib(blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Non-randomized Arm
group.description: Participants not eligible for randomization were assigned to receive axitinib 5 mg BID or a reduced dose per the dose modification guideline. Dose titration was not permitted in this treatment arm.

outcome.title: ORR in Subgroups That Were Defined by Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor A (VEGFA) or Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor 3 (VEGFR3) Polymorphisms
outcome.description: ORR, defined as proportion of participants with CR or PR according to RECIST, in subgroups that were defined by VEGFA or VEGFR3 polymorphisms.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline - Beginning of the lead-in period (Cycle 1 Day 1)
outcome.population: The Safety Analysis (SA) population consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of study medication with treatment assignments designated according to actual study treatment received.

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Placebo Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Non-randomized Arm
group.description: Participants not eligible for randomization were assigned to receive axitinib 5 mg BID or a reduced dose per the dose modification guideline. Dose titration was not permitted in this treatment arm.

measure.title: ORR in Subgroups That Were Defined by Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor A (VEGFA) or Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor 3 (VEGFR3) Polymorphisms
measure.description: ORR, defined as proportion of participants with CR or PR according to RECIST, in subgroups that were defined by VEGFA or VEGFR3 polymorphisms.
measure.population: The Safety Analysis (SA) population consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of study medication with treatment assignments designated according to actual study treatment received.

outcome.title: PFS in Subgroups That Were Defined by Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor A (VEGFA) or Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor 3 (VEGFR3) Polymorphisms
outcome.description: PFS, defined as the time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, in subgroups that were defined by VEGFA or VEGFR3 polymorphisms. Estimates of the PFS curves from the Kaplan-Meier method were presented.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline - Beginning of the lead-in period (Cycle 1 Day 1)
outcome.population: The Safety Analysis (SA) population consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of study medication with treatment assignments designated according to actual study treatment received.

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Placebo Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Non-randomized Arm
group.description: Participants not eligible for randomization were assigned to receive axitinib 5 mg BID or a reduced dose per the dose modification guideline. Dose titration was not permitted in this treatment arm.

measure.title: PFS in Subgroups That Were Defined by Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor A (VEGFA) or Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor 3 (VEGFR3) Polymorphisms
measure.description: PFS, defined as the time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, in subgroups that were defined by VEGFA or VEGFR3 polymorphisms. Estimates of the PFS curves from the Kaplan-Meier method were presented.
measure.population: The Safety Analysis (SA) population consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of study medication with treatment assignments designated according to actual study treatment received.

reported_events.time_frame: AEs were reported until follow up visit. Non-SAEs: up to 28 days post last dose or upon starting new anticancer treatment, whichever was first. SAEs: up to 28 days post last dose, irrespective of new anticancer treatment.
reported_events.desc: The same event may be referred to as (serious and non-serious) AEs. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Active Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5 mg twice a day (BID) + axitinib(blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + axitinib (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + axitinib [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Placebo Titration Arm
group.description: Participants initially received axitinib 5mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 2 mg BID. After at least 2 consecutive weeks, participants satisfying the dose titration criteria had their dose level increased by one additional dose level, to axitinib 5 mg BID + placebo (blinded therapy) 5 mg BID, unless otherwise contraindicated per the investigator’s clinical judgment. The maximum total daily dose was 10 mg BID (axitinib 5mg BID + placebo [blinded therapy] 5 mg BID).

group.title: Non-randomized Arm
group.description: Participants not eligible for randomization were assigned to receive axitinib 5 mg BID or a reduced dose per the dose modification guideline. Dose titration was not permitted in this treatment arm.

group.title: Discontinued Prior to Randomization
group.description: Participants who were discontinued prior to randomization to either treatment or non-randomization arms.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
